newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Bangladesh taka ends weaker on devaluation fears.
newsitem.headline: Bangladesh taka ends weaker on devaluation fears.

text.p: Concern over a potential devaluation forced the Bangladesh taka to close weaker at 43.7600/7700 to the dollar in a volatile interbank session ahead of the Friday weekend, dealers said.

The local unit was quoted in wide range at 43.7500/8000 per dollar in early trade and stayed under pressure as banks remained non-responsive to dollar demand. The unit closed at 43.7495/7500 to the dollar on Wednesday.

"Banks were already under the grip of a devaluation (of taka) fear. Wednesday's devaluation of Pakistani rupee made them more suspicious," said one dealer. The interbank call money rates closed at five to six percent against previous 4.5 to six percent.
Banks in Bangladesh close transactions by midday on Thursday. -- Dhaka Newsroom +880-2-506363
